Entries.default: A rune-etched medallion hangs against the breastplate of this blood red armor, secured around its gorget by a steel chain.
The pendant bears several potent sigils of conjuration and binding - doubtlessly designed to infuse the armor with soul essence and animate it with a semblance of intellect and life.
The pristine crimson patina of this armor seems almost to shift and flow as you peer at it. Gold gilds the plates, and a fine latticework of rune etchings run along the trim.
The armor trembles, then sags, whatever spell binding it together broken.

As your fingers brush the medallion, a pulse of magical power thrums through your hand and up your arm.

With a whisper of scraping metal plates, the armor's helmet turns towards you...

You dig among your gear and come up with a piece of chalk. You grind it down, and - with the utmost care - wipe it into the sigils. Your defacement should - you hope - neutralize the enchantment without triggering it.
You steady your breathing and focus your mind on your training. With an outstretched hand and a word of excoriation, you pitch your soul against the enchantment.
The blade held tight within the armor's gauntlets, however, shows signs of use, including the stains of long-dried blood.
